mosinstall.description: JAuthTools: Allows LDAP group synchronization to overwrite existing settings.

param.name: useglobal
param.label: Use Global Settings
param.description: Use the global Joomla! LDAP settings

param.name: host
param.label: Host
param.description: For example, openldap.mycompany.org

param.name: port
param.label: Port
param.description: Default port is 389

param.name: use_ldapV3
param.label: LDAP V3
param.description: Default is LDAP2, but latest versions of OpenLdap require clients to use LDAPV3

param.name: negotiate_tls
param.label: Negotiate TLS
param.description: Negotiate TLS encryption with the LDAP server. This requires all traffic to and from my LDAP server to be encrypted.

param.name: no_referrals
param.label: Don't follow referrals
param.description: This option clears the LDAP_OPT_REFERRALS flag.You'll need to check it for Windows 2003 servers.

param.name: ldap_is_ad
param.label: LDAP directory is AD
param.description: Specifies if the LDAP directory is an Active Directory. You'll need to check it for Windows 2000 servers.

param.name: base_dn
param.label: Base DN
param.description: The base DN of your LDAP server, e.g o=mydomain.com

param.name: users_dn
param.label: Users DN
param.description: The [username] keyword is dynamically replaced by the user-provided login, so an example string is: uid=[username], dc=my-domain, dc=com

param.name: search_string
param.label: Search string
param.description: A query string used for search for a given user. The [search] keyword is dynamically replaced by the user-provided login, so an example string is: uid=[search]. Several strings can be used, separated by semicolons.

param.name: username
param.label: Connect username
param.description: The Connect String and Connect password define connection parameters for the DN lookup phase. 3 options are available:- Anonymous DN lookup. Leave both fields blank.- Administrative connection: 'Connect String' is the DN of an administrative account, e.g uid=admin,ou=users,o=mydomain.com. 'Connect password' is the actual password of your administrative account.- Connection with the user-supplied login/password: 'Connect String' is a DN, where the [login] token will be dynamically replaced by the user login, e.g uid=[login],ou=People,dc=my-domain,dc=com. 'Connect password' should be the password for the user account

param.name: password
param.label: Connect password
param.description: This should be used with the username to do prebind activities (namely with Active Directory systems)

param.name: ldap_fullname
param.label: Map FullName
param.description: The LDAP attribute that stores the fullname of your users. For most systems this will be fullName (the default), however for Active Directory this might also be displayName.

param.name: ldap_email
param.label: Map Email
param.description: The LDAP attribute that stores the email address of your users.

param.name: ldap_uid
param.label: Map User ID
param.description: The LDAP attribute that stores the user ID or login/username of your users. For most systems this will be uid (the default), however for Active Directory this is sAMAccountName.

param.name: ldap_password
param.label: Map Password
param.description: The LDAP attribute that store the password for your user.

param.name: ldap_blocked
param.label: Map User Blocked
param.description: An LDAP Attribute to map blocked users. This should be a boolean value (true or false)

param.name: ldap_groupname
param.label: Map Group Name
param.description: The attribute in LDAP storing the group name. This is used by the group mapping system.

param.name: demoteuser
param.label: Demote Users
param.description: Demote users if their group mapping or default user settings are different.

param.name: defaultgroup
param.label: Default Group
param.description: The default group to autocreate users in.

param.name: groupMap
param.label: Group Map
param.description: Maps LDAP Groups to Joomla! Groups

param.name: use_iconv
param.label: Use iconv
param.description: iconv is required to convert some fields into UTF-8 that is stored in the database. You will need iconv installed (See System -> System Info -> PHP Info) or this will error

param.name: iconv_from
param.label: Original Encoding (e.g. ISO8859-1)
param.description: This is the encoding used in your LDAP directory.

param.name: iconv_to
param.label: Target Encoding (e.g. your database)
param.description: This is the encoding used in your database server (e.g. MySQL, typically UTF-8)
